description: Lung CT Screening Reporting and Data System

entries.title: Lung-RADS 0 - Incomplete
entries.content: Prior chest CT examination(s) being located for comparison. Part or all of lungs cannot be evaluated due to motion artifact, poor inspiration, or other technical reasons.

metadata.management: Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examinations is needed. Recommend repeat LDCT when images/comparison available.
metadata.follow_up: Varies based on reason for incomplete

entries.title: Lung-RADS 1 - Negative
entries.content: No pulmonary nodules. Nodule(s) with specific benign calcification patterns: complete, central, popcorn, concentric rings (ite). Fat-containing nodules (hamartoma). Perifissural nodules <10mm (benign intrapulmonary lymph nodes).

metadata.management: Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months.

entries.title: Lung-RADS 2 - Benign Appearance or Behavior
entries.content: Solid nodule(s): <6mm total. Part solid nodule(s): <6mm total diameter. Non-solid (ground glass) nodule(s) (GGN): <30mm. Category 3 or 4 nodules unchanged for 3 or more months. Solid nodule >=6mm that has resolved. Cysts.

metadata.management: Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months.

entries.title: Lung-RADS 3 - Probably Benign
entries.content: Solid nodule(s): >=6mm to <8mm at baseline, or new 4mm to <6mm. Part solid nodule(s): >=6mm total diameter with solid component <6mm, or new <6mm total diameter. Non-solid nodule(s) (GGN): >=30mm, or new >=20mm to <30mm.

entries.title: Lung-RADS 4A - Suspicious
entries.content: Solid nodule(s): >=8mm to <15mm at baseline, or new 6mm to <8mm, or growing <8mm. Part solid nodule(s): >=6mm total diameter with solid component >=6mm to <8mm, or new or growing <4mm solid component.

metadata.management: 3 month LDCT. PET/CT may be used when there is a >=8mm solid component.

entries.title: Lung-RADS 4B - Very Suspicious
entries.content: Solid nodule(s): >=15mm at baseline, or new or growing >=8mm. Part solid nodule(s): Solid component >=8mm, or new or growing >=4mm solid component. Endobronchial nodule.

metadata.management: Chest CT with or without contrast, PET/CT and/or tissue sampling depending on the probability of malignancy, comorbidities, and patient preferences. PET/CT may be used when there is a >=8mm solid component.

entries.title: Lung-RADS 4X - Category 3 or 4 with Additional Features
entries.content: Category 3 or 4 nodules with additional features or imaging findings that increase the suspicion of malignancy including: spiculation, lymphadenopathy, satellite nodules, metastatic disease, or pleural effusion.

metadata.management: As per Category 4A or 4B depending on underlying finding, with additional workup as indicated by clinical judgment. More aggressive follow-up may be warranted.
metadata.probability_of_malignancy: Varies based on underlying category and features

entries.title: Lung-RADS S - Other Significant Findings
entries.content: Clinically significant or potentially significant findings unrelated to lung cancer. May include: coronary artery calcification, aortic aneurysm, emphysema, pulmonary fibrosis, infectious disease, pleural effusion (non-malignant), thyroid nodules, breast masses, adrenal nodules, renal masses, hepatic lesions, lymphadenopathy (non-malignant), skeletal findings.

metadata.management: As indicated by specific finding. May require additional imaging, clinical correlation, or referral.

entries.title: Solid Nodule Size Criteria - Baseline
entries.content: Solid nodule measurement: Use average of long and short axis diameters on the same axial image. Round to nearest whole number. <6mm: Category 2. 6mm to <8mm: Category 3. 8mm to <15mm: Category 4A. >=15mm: Category 4B. For multiple nodules, use the largest nodule for categorization.

metadata.measurement_method: Average of long and short axis on axial image

entries.title: Solid Nodule Size Criteria - New
entries.content: New solid nodule measurement and categorization: <4mm: Category 2. 4mm to <6mm: Category 3. 6mm to <8mm: Category 4A. >=8mm: Category 4B. New nodules require comparison to prior CT to confirm they are truly new.

metadata.measurement_method: Average of long and short axis on axial image

entries.title: Part-Solid Nodule Size Criteria
entries.content: Part-solid (subsolid) nodule measurement: Total size measured on lung window, solid component measured on mediastinal window. Category determined by solid component size: Solid <6mm: Category 3. Solid 6mm to <8mm: Category 4A. Solid >=8mm: Category 4B. For part-solid nodules, the solid component size is the primary determinant of malignancy risk.

metadata.measurement_method: Total size on lung window, solid component on mediastinal window

entries.title: Ground Glass Nodule (GGN) Size Criteria
entries.content: Non-solid (ground-glass) nodule measurement: Average of long and short axis on lung window. <30mm at baseline: Category 2. >=30mm at baseline or new >=20mm: Category 3. Persistent pure GGNs have low malignancy rate; those >=20mm may represent pre-invasive lesions (AIS/MIA).

metadata.measurement_method: Average of long and short axis on lung window

entries.title: Nodule Growth Definition
entries.content: Growing nodule: Increase of >=1.5mm in average diameter from prior CT. Growth should be assessed using same technique and window settings. Volume doubling time (VDT) <400 days suggests malignancy. Growth upgrades category: Growing <8mm solid → 4A. Growing >=8mm solid → 4B. New or growing solid component in part-solid nodule is particularly concerning.

entries.title: Suspicious Nodule Features
entries.content: Features that increase suspicion of malignancy and may warrant 4X modifier: Spiculated margins (corona radiata sign). Upper lobe location (especially right upper lobe). Adjacent pleural retraction or thickening. Vessel convergence sign (vessels drawn toward nodule). Air bronchogram within solid nodule. Bubble-like lucencies (early cavitation). Solid component growth in part-solid nodule.

entries.title: Benign Nodule Features
entries.content: Features suggesting benign etiology: Complete/central/popcorn/laminated calcification. Fat attenuation (-40 to -120 HU, suggests hamartoma). Perifissural location with triangular/lentiform shape (intrapulmonary lymph node). Stability over >=2 years. Smooth margins and round shape (less specific).

entries.title: Measurement Technique
entries.content: Nodule measurement best practices: Use same technique for baseline and follow-up. Measure on axial images with <1.5mm slice thickness. Use lung window for total size and GGN. Use mediastinal window for solid component of part-solid nodules. Measure longest axis and perpendicular short axis on same image. Report average of two measurements rounded to nearest mm.

entries.title: Multiple Nodules Management
entries.content: When multiple nodules are present: Categorize based on the nodule with highest suspicion (most concerning size/features). May report up to 4 dominant nodules. Note pattern: random (metastatic), perilymphatic (sarcoidosis), or centrilobular (infection/inflammation). If all nodules are miliary pattern, consider infectious or metastatic etiology.

metadata.clinical_significance: Use most suspicious nodule for category

entries.title: Prior CT Comparison
entries.content: Comparison with prior imaging is essential for: Determining if nodule is new. Assessing growth (>=1.5mm increase). Confirming stability (no growth over >=3 months for Cat 3/4, >=2 years for benign). Category 0 may be assigned when prior CT is needed but unavailable.

entries.title: Lung-RADS Version History
entries.content: Lung-RADS version history: v1.0 (2014): Initial release. v1.1 (2019): Added 4X modifier, clarified part-solid criteria. v2022: Current version with refined size thresholds, clearer growth definitions, and S modifier for incidental findings.
